results.title: Metformin ameliorates bladder dysfunction in a rat model of partial bladder outlet obstruction.
results.text_hl: Our study indicated that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is a potential drug to inhibit @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001745 @@@bladder@@@ remodeling and alleviate @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001745 @@@bladder dysfunction@@@.

citations.NLM: Chen L, Lv L, Zhang L, Gao Z, Liu Y, Wang S, Zhou N, Xia Y, Cui J, Jiang X, Zhang X, Li Y, Shi B. Metformin ameliorates bladder dysfunction in a rat model of partial bladder outlet obstruction. Am J Physiol Renal Physiol. 2021 May 1;320(5):F838-F858. PMID: 33645317

results.title: Double benefit of metformin treatment: improved bladder function in cyclophosphamide-induced cystitis and enhanced cytotoxicity in cancer cells.
results.text_hl: Histopathological evaluation confirmed that CP induced a severe @DISEASE_Cystitis @DISEASE_MESH:D003556 @@@cystitis@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ partially inhibited CP-induced @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001745 @@@bladder damage@@@.

citations.NLM: Engin S, Barut EN, Soysal AC, Keskin O, Kerimoglu G, Kadioglu M, Sezen S. Double benefit of metformin treatment: improved bladder function in cyclophosphamide-induced cystitis and enhanced cytotoxicity in cancer cells. results.title: Metformin abrogates the voiding dysfunction induced by prolonged methylglyoxal intake.
results.text_hl: Here, we aimed to investigate if @CHEMICAL_Pyruvaldehyde @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011765 @@@MGO@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001745 @@@bladder dysfunction@@@ can be reversed by @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Oliveira AL, de Oliveira MG, Medeiros ML, Mónica FZ, Antunes E. Metformin abrogates the voiding dysfunction induced by prolonged methylglyoxal intake. Eur J Pharmacol. 2021 Nov 5;910():174502. PMID: 34516950

results.title: Inhibition of TNF-alpha Improves the Bladder Dysfunction That Is Associated With Type 2 Diabetes
results.text_hl: ...Combination of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@) and @GENE_TNFRSF1A @GENE_21937 @@@TNFRI@@@ synergistically improved the @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001745 @@@bladder dysfunction@@@ in 12-week-old @DISEASE_615441 @DISEASE_OMIM:615441 @@@DKO@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

results.title: High Glucose with Insulin Induces Cell Cycle Progression and Activation of Oncogenic Signaling of Bladder Epithelial Cells Cotreated with Metformin and Pioglitazone
results.text_hl: The cells derived from @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001745 @@@bladder@@@ epithelial cells (HBlEpCs) were treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Pioglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077205 @@@pioglitazone@@@ with high @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ and @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@.

results.title: The effects of metformin with lifestyle therapy in polycystic ovary syndrome: a randomized double-blind study.
results.text_hl: The @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ group had increased @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhea@@@ and @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, but fewer @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001745 @@@bladder infections@@@ and @DISEASE_Musculoskeletal_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D009140 @@@musculoskeletal complaints@@@.

citations.NLM: Ladson G, Dodson WC, Sweet SD, Archibong AE, Kunselman AR, Demers LM, Williams NI, Coney P, Legro RS. The effects of metformin with lifestyle therapy in polycystic ovary syndrome: a randomized double-blind study. Fertil Steril. 2011 Mar 1;95(3):1059-66.e1-7. PMID: 21193187

results.title: Role of PKC and CaV1.2 in Detrusor Overactivity in a Model of Obesity Associated with Insulin Resistance in Mice
results.text_hl: Cystometry evidenced augmented frequency, non-void contractions and post-void pressure in @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ that were also prevented by @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ treatment improved the insulin sensitivity, and normalized the in vitro @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001745 @@@bladder hypercontractility@@@ and @DISEASE_Heart_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@cystometric dysfunction@@@ in @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

citations.NLM: Leiria LO, Sollon C, Calixto MC, Lintomen L, Mónica FZ, Anhê GF, De Nucci G, Zanesco A, Grant AD, Antunes E. Role of PKC and CaV1.2 in Detrusor Overactivity in a Model of Obesity Associated with Insulin Resistance in Mice PLoS One. 2012;7(11):e48507. PMID: 23144896
